website_summaries.verdict: One of Timbuk2's cheaper pack options, this attractive bag is great for those wanting to save a few bucks and maintain some style.
pros: Professional design is ideal for students and working adults alike
Front pocket for storing smaller items
cons: Laptop compartment could do with higher-quality padding

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, roomy
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Sturdy, roomy, lots of small pockets, and two separate large pockets. My 13 inch MacBook Pro fits with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: ann.knee

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time! No visible damage. This is a very nice looking backpack. Good quality and comfortable to wear. It is a relatively slim backpack. If you're using this for school and you have more than 3 books and the rest of your school supplies, this may not be for you. But I like it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Ryry

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: What a great bag! I'm a petite woman so it's always a struggle to find a good, functional bag that doesn't look like a huge turtle shell on my back. I use this for commuting to and from work via bus and it hits all the must-haves: fits my laptop, notepad, a hoodie, small make up bag, hairbrush, keys, keys, phone, wallet, pens, water bottle. It's adjustable so it's right up against my back, no gaping. It's slim so I won't accidentally smack anyone seated on the bus with it if I'm stuck standing. The colors are subtle and elegant. I can't state enough how much I love the shorter height and slimmer width on this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, durable, fits the daily commuter essentials
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to downgrade from a larger North Face backpack and have been looking for a smaller day bag to take to work and also keep a change of clothes from the gym - this is great! It's lightweight and at first doesn't feel like it's going to be durable, but it is. It perfectly fits my 15" laptop, gym clothes (no shoes), lunch, keys, etc for the day. It's not going to be large enough for a weekend trip but it does the job for everyday commuter essentials.
customer_reviews.author: Ktho

customer_reviews.title: Great commuter backpack!
customer_reviews.text: Great commuter bag! I commute to and from work 5 days a week on a train and sometimes on the bus. I needed a bag that would not cause any stress or fuss. In addition it needed to be comfortable and appealing. This bag fits that requirement! Pros: + super comfortable + plenty of space and pockets. Has one main pocket, another addition pocket with slots, 2 smaller pockets for quick and easy access and a water bottle slot. + quality is great
customer_reviews.author: Wandering Self

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but bad zippers
customer_reviews.text: The backpack is is a very nice looking bag and the perfect size that I was hoping for. I thought the brand Timbuk2 was a company that always looked good and looked durable. I have a 13" Macbook Pro, which fits perfectly in the separate sleeve. There's ample space for other books and folders. It has some good pockets of the right size. One fatal flaw though - the zipper on both of the main pockets are not strong enough to stay closed. Several times already, I closed the zippers but any weight in the bag will separate the zipper. It's a quick fix but really flawed since I'm not confident if my bag will stay closed or not!
customer_reviews.author: ancient_reader

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 15" Laptops.
customer_reviews.text: Its a nice pack. I watched yourube videos on this before purchasing. Timbuk2 warranty and quality is superior. Reason for 3 stars is because this says it can fit 15" laptops, but it really can't. I primarily bought this for hauling around my work computer which is a 15" Prostar/Clevo. I can't put it in the laptop sleeve and close the bag. I can put it in the non padded compartment, but that kind of defeats the purpose. Still undecided on whether I will keep this or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice enough for work but only good for weekend travel
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing super amazing about this backpack, but there is nothing bad either. It's just really good. Would recommend for high school or college student in a heartbeat. Also office workers who want to bring a backpack could use this one(once you chop off the ridiculous bottle opener) and very few people would complain. You can get more than you think in it and it will keep on ticking. The straps take a minute to break in(i.e. months) but all the padding an features have everything modern backpack checklists require. I eventually moved on to osprey pixel as i needed something more water resistant for transporting work assigned laptop and larger for week long trips.
customer_reviews.author: Fibinaci

customer_reviews.title: Nice materials. Seems small.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised when I received this how small it was. I should have paid closer attention to the dimensions I guess. This would be fine for a day bag to and from work but I wouldn’t want to use it to travel with. It also lacks any padding for the laptop so you don’t want to be very rough with it. I have several Timbuk2 bags and all are well built and this one is no exception, but the size of will keep me from carrying it very often.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Good size for commuting
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a smaller back pack and this one works for me. It's pretty stylish (more urban looking than my old one) and carries what I need comfortably. I like the outside pockets for my lip balm, tissues etc - things you want easy access to. I wish there was a key keeper though. I wouldn't put my keys in the outer pockets (security), and they get lost in the inner ones. I also don't get the weird, hipster bottle opener on the shoulder strap... we tried it just because it was there & it's awkward. I just cut it off. Anyway, overall it's a well made, good looking and nice sized back pack.
customer_reviews.author: TooMuchStuff

customer_reviews.title: I was unsure if I liked it. It was a touch smaller and had ...
customer_reviews.text: I have another Timbuk2 bag - slightly bigger and more pockets. When I got this one, I was unsure if I liked it. It was a touch smaller and had less interior organization pockets, but when I went to use it as my everyday carry, I loved it. It's a little simpler, but useful for when I'm not carrying a ton of stuff. The bigger bag with more pockets is still useful for heavier days and this is good for an average day. Timbuk2 bags are so awesome. I want another!
customer_reviews.author: Mr&MrsR

customer_reviews.title: Well-designed backpack for Macbook Pro 13 inch
customer_reviews.text: The compartments in this bag will take some getting used to. But you won't be able to find a better laptop bag for a 13 inch Macbook Pro. Laptop slides easily in and out of back of bag. Front of bag has clever and slim pockets. Front of backpack has a functional bottle opener! Perhaps the best part is that you can put it on one shoulder, and because the strap is wider than most backpacks, it's not really a strain on your shoulder or back. I had to get another backpack because one shoulder strap was constantly slipping lower than the other and it was not good for the back.
customer_reviews.author: ijiguy

customer_reviews.title: Great Daily Use Bag
customer_reviews.text: On my second one of these, because my dog decided to chew off the straps. This is the best backpack I've owned. Great for work and travel. It's my every day bag that carries either a 15" or 13" MBP (depending on work vs personal). It holds my water bottle, breakfast, lunch, Red Bull's for the day, and all the cables that I think I need on a daily basis. This is my second Timbuk2 bag, coming from a much larger Especial Medio Backpack. I prefer this smaller size quite a bit. I'm 6' 230 lbs and it's quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Hainey

customer_reviews.title: the bag is also very stylish and feels like a premium product
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this bag for school, as the one I had was not suiting my needs. The bag was slightly smaller than I expected, however I was able to fit just as much (if not more) into this bag even though it is a smaller form factor than my old one which is a huge plus for navigating hallways that are overcrowded with students. On top of the functionality, the bag is also very stylish and feels like a premium product. PROS - Lightweight - Small but spacious - Stylish - Feels durable - Zippers work well and are easy to hold onto (they have a rubbery texture) CONS - Shoulder straps could use a bit more padding
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for work
customer_reviews.text: I have to carry my laptop to and from work every day, so a backpack is a must for me. This one is great because it's stylish and professional enough to carry into the office while still being very functional with lots of pockets and compartments. It's relatively compact and doesn't stick out from my body too far (i.e. I'm not accidentally bumping into people on the metro) but still holds a ton of stuff. I can easily fit my 15" laptop, charger, notebooks, and a pair of heels into the main compartment alone. It's certainly more than I ever planned to spend on a backpack, but it was worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Princess Moonbeam

customer_reviews.title: Not enough organization
customer_reviews.text: I love Timbuk 2 products in general, but I did not love this backpack. It looks nice, but in reality it does not feel like the quality that you'd expect for Timbuk 2. It is definitely a bargain for the name, and so you should expect that you get what you pay for. Pros: Great look, padded straps, decent size Cons: Fabric is not heavy, compartments lack better organization
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: I currently use HP backpack and it is awesome. holds 2 15 inch laptops
customer_reviews.text: I'm planning to return this product as it feels flimsy and cheap. I expected more from the name Timbuk2. I currently use HP backpack and it is awesome. holds 2 15 inch laptops, 2 iPads, all the plugs, etc, a couple of books without abnormal bulge. And it stands tall and not fall over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unorganized
customer_reviews.text: Meh. I bought this to replace a Samsonite backpack that does not have a side water bottle holder. This bag gives me more space, especially since I don’t have to put my water bottle inside, but the space is not as organized. It gets sloppy and does not have inside zippers for lose change, passport, keys, and other small items, so they end up floating around the backpack rather than secured where I can find them.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne

customer_reviews.title: Functional and Well Constructed
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I know it is just a backpack and there a dozens and dozens of them out there. I rarely write reviews but I had to acknowledge this bag. It is well constructed, handy pockets and easy on the back with my laptop in it. It does what it is supposed to do and does it well, what more needs to be said?
customer_reviews.author: babyboomernorcal

customer_reviews.title: Fits my needs
customer_reviews.text: Thus far it's been great I considered exchanging it for one with a sternum strap, truthfully, it's not necessary. It carries a 15inch laptop, plus shoes, lunch and headphone case with no issues Comfortable too
customer_reviews.author: allonespeed

customer_reviews.title: Great light backpack for traveling!
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy and light weight backpack. Good for traveling with lots of pockets and space. I have the Vert and this one is much lighter in weight and the material is not as thick; still a super comfortable bag! One water bottle side pocket only and in smaller size. The laptop compartment could use more cushion for the inside partition, material is thin but the side touches your back is nicely cushioned.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence H.

customer_reviews.title: Love the look and size of this bag...but where's the padding?
customer_reviews.text: I really like the size and look of this bag, plus it has lots of compartments to help find things easier. The only thing I was disappointed with is that there is no padding at the bottom of the bag...so don't drop it or lay it down without thinking about what kind of surface it lands on or it's likely to put a dent in your laptop or worse. Overall, I'll likely stick with this because of the price and overall design.
customer_reviews.author: April M.

customer_reviews.title: C+ bag for size, loses points for the single bottle pouch and the saggy organizational section
customer_reviews.text: The bag size and capacity is just right. My only two gripes are the asymmetrical external water bottle pouch and the flimsy organizing pockets. The organizational section inside the second largest section just sags, making it pretty useless. I put my Moleskine notebook in the pocket designed for a tablet and a pack of wet wipes in the other pouch. The entire section just sags unwieldy making it difficult to maneuver around to the stuff below.
customer_reviews.author: norcimmus

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Lighter Weight
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this backpack to reduce the amount of things I carry around especially on holiday, to spare my back the stress. Surprisingly, it is very roomy, more so than I expected, but less so than my previous one, which was my goal. The straps and loops seem very strong, so I anticipate good durability.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R.

customer_reviews.title: It's not a bag - IT'S A LIFESTYLE
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is incredible. Best part? The bottle opener, for opening bottles on the go. Just when I thought I'd never have a solution to running around with unopened bottles in my hands, along came this backpack. Sometimes I fill it up with bottles, go out for a walk, pop them with the bottle opener and hand them to strangers. It's just like a Coca-Cola commercial, but without Don Draper.
customer_reviews.author: NY773

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small to medium size backpack to use while traveling around France for a month. Big enough to hold an umbrella, lite jacket, phone, and perhaps small gifts purchased along the way. This fit the bill. Sturdy pack with good zippers and pulls. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tominia

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect...
customer_reviews.text: well made, compact, capacity is good for main compartments. the drink holder holds commuter mug with no problem. I'd give this more points if the two front zippered compartments were roomier. A wallet and keys will barely fit in the bottom one. A sunglass case will barely fit in the top one.
customer_reviews.author: gd

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, a little small.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this looking for a good storage space for my laptop, lots of pockets and pouches within the two main bag sections. Great build quality and convenient straps and hooks on the outside. Not a negative aspect for me but the backpack is a little smaller than a typical backpack. Definitely more compact which makes it great for travelling. My daily carry consists of a laptop, couple cables, headphones and a change of clothes for the gym but you will struggle to fit a pair of running shoes in there. Great for a hike or laptop transport.
customer_reviews.author: domco

customer_reviews.title: Great Day Backpack
customer_reviews.text: It is fairly small and simplistic. Great day pack. I can fit a 15" laptop and a tablet and have room left. The water bottle pocket is nice. No other real bells or whistles. For air travel you might want something a little beefier, but it will do the job. Craftsmanship is good...well stitched and reinforced where it matters.
customer_reviews.author: chaw704352

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Solid backpack, although I wish they had more padding on the straps. Plenty of storage for someone who carries a laptop and a few notebooks. I used to carry a huge backpack around campus, but these are smaller and lighter too so way more convenient. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Apoorwa Giri

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality! Very durable! Very sleek!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this backpack. My boyfriend has been using it for almost half a year and it still looks new. The compartments within the backpack are so well-placed that there is always a use for it. Definitely a great school backpack and work backpack. You can definitely travel with it as well. It looks very sleek when worn. It may look compact but you can fit so much in that backpack. I would definitely repurchase when it eventually breaks but I don't see that happening for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Not red but maroon.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the red one, looking at the pictures it looked like it was bright red which I liked but when it arrived it wasn't close to the picture at all. The red was in the maroon side of the color spectrum. The zippers are also really hard to use, it feels like I will rip them off trying to open the compartments. Only thing I like is that its a compact backpack but still capable of carrying a lot of things if needed. I'm thinking of returning it but holding off to see if the maroon will grow on me.
customer_reviews.author: xtian

customer_reviews.title: thin tall and wide and light, great daily commuter in the DC metro
customer_reviews.text: thin, tall and wide this backpack has been my daily commuter bag in the great DC metro area. The heather gray blends well with anything I wear and the zippers and string handles are sturdy. not sure how it would handle spot clean (since it can't go into the washer) if i was to spill my lunch but that hasn't happened yet.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: The color is fantastic and the bag itself is exactly what you'd expect ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife and she loves it! The color is fantastic and the bag itself is exactly what you'd expect from a top tier edc bag for the city. The straps are comfortable even for someone with sensitive shoulders. The bag tightens comfortable close to your back and the airflow prevents sweat from being a nuisance. Top product as I've come to expect from timbuk2.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Great design. Second Timbuk2 Bag
customer_reviews.text: Work recently upgraded me from a 13" to 15" laptop. For years I've been using a Timbuk2 Command series Messenger. I decided with the larger size to try out the Parkside. I'm really impressed with how well it places a bulk of the weight on the strongest part of your back. Very high quality construction, especially given the price!
customer_reviews.author: J. McC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent backpack for work and basic needs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my wife, and she loves it! She was using an oversized purse to carry her laptop to and from work, but had a lot of other items (wallet, laptop power cord, makeup bag, folio, etc.) also in the purse, and they would get lost and mixed up in her purse. The Timbuk2 backpack has plenty of pockets for keeping things organized, and a pocket specifically for her laptop. In addition, it's roomy enough for her to have everything else neatly placed in the main pocket, including sometimes a second outfit and pair of shoes. She's very happy with it. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Shaun P.

customer_reviews.title: Like this pack for EDC
customer_reviews.text: Like this pack for EDC. Holds my laptop, tablet, and all my daily essentials. No straps to dangle or get caught. Water bottle pockets on the side hold my coffee tumbler.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for daily commute.
customer_reviews.text: The straps aren’t perfect but close enough. Not crazy about the strap material, especially when wearing tank tops, and they tend to slip. Still, I LOVE this backpack! The pockets alone are enough for me (thoughtfully placed and not too many). Great for my 1mi commute to work.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this backpack. I'm a backpack kinda guy since I'm in school and it has great functionality. Its not too big but not small either, Fits two big textbooks and has a laptop sleeve. It'd be nice if the laptop divider would be made out of something more durable material but it still works great in keeping my backpack in place. I get a lot of compliments and looks classy. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack, with a questionable zipper.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent backpack- looks very professional and it's comfortable to carry around. The only complaint I have is that the zipper for the largest pocket seems really tight.... to the point where when I'm trying to round the corner of the bag it ALWAYS catches. Doesn't seem to be causing any problems, and it seems secure, but it is a little frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Day Pack. A little on the same size.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, little pack with a ton of potential. Unfortunately, I had to send mine back due to it's size. I needed something just a little bit bigger to carry all of my tech when I'm traveling on business and this pack is just too small to be used as a carry on/travel bag. Still, if you're looking for an awesome day pack, then this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H. Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Great and durable back pack
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but praise for this backpack. Traveled with it to Hawaii. Pleany of space, comfy and good bottle holder. It is also very well made. I love tim buk 2 products. I recommend this packpack to anyone who loveas a good sturdy pack.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn B

customer_reviews.title: Great work/school back pack!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, very efficient and easy to take around. Great travel backpack! You do need a laptop sleeve as the laptop pocket is not padded. I use it for school and for work! I love this color! I'd recommend to anyone! Only not a five star because there are some things I wish it had like padding, but if you are wanting that and more check out Timbuk2's other backpacks. Great reviews on youtube for products too! Also, quick shipment! Got it as expected, came in a larger box in perfect condition!
customer_reviews.author: Steph J.

customer_reviews.title: Great for college students.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is smaller than most standard backpacks, but it is really nice looking. My teenage son is 6' tall and a college student, and it fits everything he needs for class, including his laptop. It's comfortable on his body and a nice brand, so he is happy.
customer_reviews.author: NC girl

customer_reviews.title: Timuk2 Parkside Laptop Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. I did not know how much a simple, functional backpack can make my life better. I am 5'1" tall wearing petite clothing, so I was afraid that any laptop backpack may look big on me. But I think this is perfect. The laptop compartment sits just above my hipbone, which makes it very easy on my shoulder. Some reviewer said that the fabric looks cheap, but I think it's individual preference. The front part looks like it's waterproof, but not the top and sides.
customer_reviews.author: cookiemonster636

customer_reviews.title: The BEST backpack I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bag I’ve ever owned. It’s simple. There are enough pockets to hold the things I need pockets for. The inside is deep so you can store not only your laptop but books and a set of headphones. I’ve owned a ton of bags and this one is the perfect size. My only complaint is the resistance on the zippers. It’s a little more than I’d like, but doesn’t take away from the backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Hannonamous

customer_reviews.title: Surprise Bottle Opener!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Timbuk2 messenger bag for over 10 years and it still holds up. I needed a backpack to save my back, so of course I went with this brand. Very comfortable, nice looking, and holds everything I need. Also, I didn't realize the strap had a bottle opener on it, so that was a pleasant surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C.

customer_reviews.title: Great back, missing just one thing...
customer_reviews.text: This a great bag, I love the size of the pockets, it allows for me to keep everything organized. It's very durable and stylish (to me anyway). The Straps are comfortable when carry extra weight, as well. The only negative would be the laptop sleeve isn't padded. It' isn't an issue for me, I have a sleeve i can place my laptop in. But that lack of padding prevents me from giving 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: This bag is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Such a great bag! I needed to step up my everyday bag game and this did the trick. From regular city walks to meetings, I always get complements. And great delivery turn around!
customer_reviews.author: Gill

customer_reviews.title: This is by far my favorite backpack - it is sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my favorite backpack - it is sturdy, has plenty of space and pockets and is comfortable to carry. I bought this for a recent trip out of the country and wanted to have all my gadgets in one place on the plane as well as have something easy to carry around the airports. The color (green) is great and very appealing. I've received several compliments on the bag and would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Appropriate for any setting
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy material with the perfect number of pockets. The bag doesn’t wrinkle easily and looks very professional. It is light and durable. What more can you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: BiomedicalEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Super Basic
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for a little more...but the pack is super basic. The pics make it seem like it has more organisation, but it is very standard. Maybe the design is a bit too out of date...should be less expensive for a basic type bag. Appears to be well made as you'd expect, but nothing special.
customer_reviews.author: A.Wit

customer_reviews.title: Shopped for many and used the department store ... but Tim-buk2 turns out the best.
customer_reviews.text: Really like it for the weight or the lack of weight. Good materials and the relative smaller foot print.
customer_reviews.author: Levng

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Overall good the only downside is it doesn't stand straight unless you have something flat in the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny L

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid everyday backpack. Actually like it more than I thought.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. The size and simplicity of the backpack. It's actually a little smaller that I thought, but in my opinion is perfect. Interesting thing that the bottle side pocket is actually a good size that can fit a litre bottle of Evian. For everyday work/workout it's perfect. Built quality is also super.
customer_reviews.author: Diman

customer_reviews.title: It works great. I do wish the laptop pocket had more ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this backpack for transporting my 13" macbook air to and from work. It works great. I do wish the laptop pocket had more padding, but other than that, no complaints. The pack is slim, stylish, and doesn't look like your average laptop bag. I've had a few other Timbuk2 bags in the past, and this one is the same quality I've come to expect from the brand. I can imagine myself using this bag for several years — so it was totally worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Love - perfect compartments for me.
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. My problem with other backpacks is, I want two accessory pockets, but I don't need one that is super deep. This one gives me two shallow pockets stacked on one another that are perfect-sized for my needs. It's comfortable, well-compartmentalized, and professional-looking.
customer_reviews.author: aggie10

customer_reviews.title: This bag isn't a dictator
customer_reviews.text: I'm insanely picky about bags and pockets, and this bag has just the right amount. I don't feel like a pack mule, not matter how full this bag is. It's comfortable, easy to adjust, and doesn't have any pockets that tell you what to put in that pocket (I don't like bags that boss me around).
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Tiddy

customer_reviews.title: Well made backpack but...
customer_reviews.text: I used a 40L wanted something smaller to carry sometimes, I got my wish! It's a nice backpack but the zippered pockets don't expand and that does make a huge difference. You just need to know when to go big or small.
customer_reviews.author: mrlzrdguy

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, compact, practical - whats not to love
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for ~9 months now. Pros: Still looks new after daily use. Protects laptop very well. Ample space to use for a daily laptop bag. Cons: Cannot use this for making 1-2 day trips.. there isn't enough space to just use this bag for travelling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon4Ever

customer_reviews.title: Great work bag
customer_reviews.text: A great, if not small backpack. I use my cell xps 15 in here and it fits perfectly. A 17 incher will not fit in here though. The small storage compartments are great for storing accessory electronics or stationary. The backpack is well made and doesn't look ugly like the targus style backpacks my coworkers use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: I freaking love this backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I freaking love this backpack! It's slim, hugs close to your spine, doesn't spill out like a turtle like so many backpacks. Well designed and attractive. I own an art gallery -- this backpack has become my new briefcase/messenger bag.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for my husband last year and he loves it. We just bought a second one for my son to use at college. A quality product!
customer_reviews.author: violets are purple

customer_reviews.title: Love Timbuk2
customer_reviews.text: This backpack has many organization compartments that fits everything you need. I use it for school and absolutely love the design and the color. Timbuk2 is definitely worth paying for.
customer_reviews.author: Moon K.

customer_reviews.title: Slim light backpack
customer_reviews.text: Excellent size backpack, just large enough to fit a weekend trips worth of gadgets without being bulky. Not a lot of padding, but that makes for a lightweight slim looking pack. The grey "midway" color is perfect and has a nice texture to it. I was able to fit 15" laptop, tablet, over ear headphones, notebook, and camera without a problem. Zippers could have a smoother travel, but that's my only complaint. 4.5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: A lot smaller than I wanted but it’s still a decent backpack. I love Timbuk2 but this average
customer_reviews.author: mdr

customer_reviews.title: perfect size, elegant
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is small and just the right size to hold a 14 or 15" laptop, notebooks and files. It has one side pocket for a water bottle, so terrific at a conference and looks really nice
customer_reviews.author: techguy

customer_reviews.title: Best Backpack for Daytrips and Commuting!
customer_reviews.text: I love backpacks for my everyday carry. For work, riding a motorcycle and daytrips, backpacks get me organized. I like the Parkside because the price is reasonable, materials and simple features are great! I have used a lot of bakcpack with one big compartment but the Parkside's two compartments give you choices where to put and sort your everyday carry. The bottlecap opener is a great plus!
customer_reviews.author: jlconferido

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made bag, light weight
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag, use it every day. Nicely padded straps. Light weight yet Sturdy. Fits 14 inch dell latitude perfect and have lot of space for other things. Zippers are good. I like how laptop pocket ends about inch above bottom. So the laptop doesn’t hit the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Veer

customer_reviews.title: excellent backpack
customer_reviews.text: love this backpack. i have been through so many, and i absolutely love this one. i always find myself carrying too much around, and this bag is the perfect compact pack that is durable, but also fits just everything i need. goes through rain just fine, doesn't look dirty in the slightest, and has just the right amount of pockets. i love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie P

customer_reviews.title: More expensive but worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I carry this as a day bag with meds, supplies and anything else I might need throughout the day and this had been my favorite backpack. I used a Nike backpack before this that did the job but the fabric started pilling and looked really bad. Timbuk2 on the other hand has worked great and still looks great. Worth the price if your looking for something to last.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Tips over
customer_reviews.text: The backpack material is sturdy, but there is no form, so it constantly tips over when placed down standing up.
customer_reviews.author: teggie

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and functional
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for going to work everyday. Sleek and not super heavy. Multiple compartments are really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Random Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great for commuters
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the backpack now for almost 4 months. It's held up to everyday use and still looks new. Plenty of room for gear along with the laptop. Hoping this commuter bag holds up over the long haul.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great slim backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I searched far and wide looking for a laptop backpack for school that wasn't hilariously thick and this one was a great fit. The laptop sleeve is unfortunately not padded, however it is elevated from the very bottom of the bag so it still does a fair job at protecting your device from impacts. The front pockets are a bit awkward at first but they are not very difficult to get used to, that being said I would have preferred a more traditional front pocket with an pen/pencil organizer. Overall the Parkside is a great option for anyone looking for a more slender laptop backpack!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Timbuk2 makes great products. This pack is no exception, it's stylish i use it for work and it doesn't look like a childs pack or something you would use while hiking!
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bag!
customer_reviews.text: I love the bag. I have a large Timbuk 2 messenger bag that is 12 years old and still going strong. I got this backpack when Amazon had it on sale, but even at full price it would still be worth it. Zippers, seams, and materials are all top quality. The laptop pocket is strong and well placed. I especially like the two small outer front zippered pockets; they're perfect for quick access items.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: A good backpack but the bottom is starting to tear within a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: I really like this backpack. However the bottom is tearing and its not going to last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Sri Sri

customer_reviews.title: When my younger brother asked me what bag he should buy that is durable and looks good. Do you want to guess what brand I ...
customer_reviews.text: Actually, this one is for my younger brother. Lets put it this way, my first timbuk2 was a H.A.L. backpack. The next one that replaced it was a timbuk2 Alibi. When my younger brother asked me what bag he should buy that is durable and looks good. Do you want to guess what brand I recommended to him?
customer_reviews.author: Prinz

customer_reviews.title: Cool back pack
customer_reviews.text: Great back pack for my son for High school he’s so rough on back packs! Tired of buying a new one each year!
customer_reviews.author: J. Seeger

customer_reviews.title: Slim n organized
customer_reviews.text: Easy to keep things organized and in its place. Looks slim but the bags holds a lot. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: K. N.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my husband, but it did not fit his needs. My son brings it to school and absolutely loves it. It has a sleek design and a lot of compartments. I have always been a fan of Timbuk2 and this didn't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: beat counter

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice small/medium size bag plenty of room for a computer and nice pockets. Only complaint would be the fabric handle on top of the bag is really small.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Great professional backpack so you don't look like a bike messenger in the Board Room
customer_reviews.text: Timbuk2 is the best company for backpacks; I love all their products. The Parkside is a very simple and clean design. Looks professional in the board room while still functional. Overall, not too much space for extras but you can easily fit your laptop, accessories, and notebooks. I bought this for its professional look; I cannot go into meetings with a giant backpack with tons of clasps and buckles! I've also traveled with this frequently and have had no issues fitting under the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Fraudulent
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be an imitation Timbuk2 bag. Terrible quality. The bag is much smaller than the dimensions listed in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Clithero

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, sleek and functional
customer_reviews.text: Slim backpack but has room for everything, including an IPAD pro. It’s a great design with the right amount of pockets and roomy interior.
customer_reviews.author: Nee2

customer_reviews.title: Timbuk2 makes good products
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made product. I also like that it isn't too large in capacity, so that there isn't too much strain on your shoulders and back. It didn't fit my work laptop, so I can't use it for work, but I can use it for everything else and I do.
customer_reviews.author: H. C. Ganey

customer_reviews.title: Thin Material
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and isn’t overly big, but the material is rather thin. (I’m comparing it to an older Timbuktu Blackbird backpack I have.) Front pockets are convenient, but they’re just pouches to throw stuff in. There are no other pockets or compartments for organizing your gear and accessories, except for the laptop sleeve/divider inside — and that’s just a thin piece of material.
customer_reviews.author: Jase Wells

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this backpack
customer_reviews.text: It's my favorite. I love the space and organization inside. Nice padded laptop sleeve. Enough room for all of my grading (I'm a teacher). I also like the pockets in the front for keys, etc.
customer_reviews.author: jillian9502

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a fan of timbuk2 for over 15 years. I’m constantly impressed with their products. This bag was ordered to cover for my short airplane commutes and has been an excellent addition to my life. I was skeptical of the color scheme at first but once arrived I loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Arndt

customer_reviews.title: but it's perfect. Everything fits but it somehow feels compact
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that could hold my gym clothes, shoes, food, laptop and some work notebooks... but also wanted the backpack to not be bulky. Bought this backpack unsure if it could do the job, but it's perfect. Everything fits but it somehow feels compact. Love that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pack for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great pack for the price. I like the crisp fabric as it prevents the bag from sagging. The zippers are high quality and the pack has all of the needed compartments in the correct places.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Guy

customer_reviews.title: Very sleek and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of the backpack. Straps are very comfortable on the shoulders. Wish the bottle holder was a but bigger for my hydroflask. Also hope the zippers will ease up with use. Zippers are a bit hard to zip up. Overall love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap in terms of quality
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the backpack feels cheap. I was hoping it to be good based on the reviews I saw on YouTube & here but I felt it to be fake
customer_reviews.author: Yashwanth G.

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy backpack
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy backpack. Knocked off a star because it seems to rub my bottom back area more than other backpacks and as a result my clothes have pilled a lot in that area. But otherwise I love it. It's not so big that it's bulky-looking on me but it's roomy enough for essentials plus my laptop for school.
customer_reviews.author: I. Carino

customer_reviews.title: Light and don’t feel much weight carrying 15 inch mac
customer_reviews.text: Light and compact. Perfect for my daily commute. Fits Mac Pro 15. No padding though, just you know.
customer_reviews.author: Vivi@NJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: I have had this bag for just a couple of weeks. It is a little smaller than I was expecting but it does hold my 17.5 inch laptop. So far it seems to be of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best backpack i've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best backpack i've ever owned, hands down. I commute to work daily on the train and this has seen every element. It's never let me down, and its built like a tank. "Think seatbelt/fire hose material as the reinforcements for the shoulder straps" durable. Doesn't compare to north face, incase, or any other backpack out there. Buy it. Now. Do it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, but a little smaller than we realized.
customer_reviews.text: Wish we realized how small this was. It’s great quality though.
customer_reviews.author: Duc Dang

customer_reviews.title: Very small
customer_reviews.text: Nothing against the quality of the bag but be warned - it is TINY. Other reviews mentions that it is small, but I think it needs to be re-emphasized. As a bigger guy, (6'2") this bag barely fit on me and looked ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: TIMBUK2 Parkside Laptop Backpack
product_meta.description: A dressed up travel-friendly backpack with laptop protection. Padded laptop sleeves fit up to a 15" MacBook Pro. Front zip pocket for small bits. Internal organizer for pens, phones, and other small stuff. 20 liter volume.
feature_bullets: THE PARKSIDE: A dressed up travel-friendly backpack with laptop protection

KEEP IT ORGANIZED: Front zip pocket for keeping small items in check; Internal organizer for pens, phones, and other small stuff; Secure zip pocket for earbuds, stylus, cards, and cash; Large main compartment fits books, lunch, and a light jacket;

CLEVER EXTRAS: On-strap bottle opener for party tricks and quick refreshment; Vista loop for attaching blinky bike lights; Elasticized external side pocket for water bottle or U-lock; Internal slip pocket fits up to a 15" laptop
MATERIALS & FIT: Custom Timbuk2 print liner; Custom-fit strap design for a truer, more comfortable fit; Ventilated back panel to give your back breathing room

LIFETIME WARRANTY: Timbuk2 stands behind the legendary quality and craftsmanship of all our products; We also embrace the wild, twisty ways of life; If there is a defect in the materials or workmanship we will repair the bag at our discretion for the lifetime of the product

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
